competencies.name: Gather essential and accurate information about patients
Make informed diagnostic and therapeutic decisions
Develop and carry out patient management plans
Counsel and educate patients and families
Perform competently medical and invasive procedures
Provide health care services aimed at preventing health problems
Demonstrate knowledge of established and evolving biomedical, clinical, and cognate sciences
Apply this knowledge to patient care
Demonstrate investigatory and analytical thinking
Acquire and use new knowledge in practice
Analyze practice using quality improvement methods
Locate, appraise, and assimilate evidence from scientific studies
Obtain and use information about own population of patients
Apply knowledge of study designs and statistical methods
Use information technology to manage information and support decisions
Facilitate learning of students and other health care professionals
Create and sustain therapeutically effective relationships
Use effective listening skills and elicit information
Communicate effectively with patients, families, and public
Work effectively with others as a member or leader of a team
Demonstrate compassion, integrity, and respect for others
Demonstrate responsiveness to patient needs
Demonstrate respect for patient privacy and autonomy
Demonstrate accountability to patients, society, and the profession
Demonstrate sensitivity to diverse patient populations
Work effectively in various health care delivery settings
Coordinate patient care within the health care system
Incorporate cost awareness and risk-benefit analysis
Advocate for quality patient care and optimal systems
Participate in identifying system errors and implementing solutions
